parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I think, (b) I think, judge, (c) I direct the mind to, seek for, (d) I observe, (e) I care for.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Of one accord. From sun and psuche; co-spirited, i.e. Similar in sentiment.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
